div.l: And bad him go wᵗith sorowe ⁊and wᵗith meschaunce
And thus this Ioly prentys had his leue
Now let him ryot al the night or leue
And for ther is no thef wᵗithoute a lowke
That helpeth him to waste ⁊and to sowke
Of that he brybe can or borowe may
Anon he sente his bed ⁊and his array
Unto a compere of his owne sort
That loued dys reuell ⁊and dysport
And had a wyf that hured for a contynaunce
A shoppe ⁊and swyued for hur sustynaunce
And thus wᵗith horedom ⁊and bryberye
To geder thei vsed till thei honged hye
For who so euel byeth shal make a sory sale
And thus I make an ende of my tale
Here bigȳnneth the ꝓprolog of the seriaıı̄untes tale
Ovre ost say wel that the bright sonne
The ark of his artificiall day hath ronne
Al thaugh he were nat the deppest taught in lore
The ferthe part and half an hour ⁊and more
He wyst it was the xviij of day
Of Aprile that is messyngere to May
And say well that the shadwe of euery tre
Was as in lengthe the same quantyte
That was the body gret that caused hit
And ther fore bi his shadwe he tok wit
That phebus wᵗith that shone clere ⁊and bright
Degrees was xlv clomben on hight
For that day is in latitude
Hit is ten of the cloke he con conclude
And sodeinly he can plight his hors aboute
¶ Lordynges qduod he I warne yow all this route
